intro: Amphilophium ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian amphilophium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair. Amphilophium ecuadorense is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
